Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: J D
Reviews.Content: Great location. 1 block from the Alfonso XIII metro stop. Great staff, REALLY clean room, air-conditioning worked great. You're in Madrid so there is so much to do, you only need your room for sleep. Comfortable bed, clean bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our needs. It was very convenient to the metro. The staff was pleasant and helpful, the rooms were clean and modern. A little far from the city center, but the metro gets you there quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Happy choice I made”
Reviews.Author: ChachaAce
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, reception speaks English + makes a very good effort to help English speaking guests. Got the suite and it was really nice. Wooden-ish floors. The bathroom was separated into a dressing area with washing bin and another room containing bathtubs and toilet. It was clean, the toilet occasionally had weird smell but it wasn't much of an issue. Loved the bed, never wanted to get up!!! Breakfast was a good selection. Not much to choose from but really good. The first day they had a nespresso machine which disappeared on the next day. They offered american breakfast as per request on the first day too. Scrambled eggs and bacon were lovely. The next days, they kinda replaced it with cook scrambled eggs for you to scoop up at the buffet line which looked + tasted horrible. But I didn't mind since the selection of cold cuts, bread, juice, fruits, cereal were enough to keep me happy. Staff are helpful. Had a really nice stay. Cons are, it's not in the centre of everything but the metro is one minute away and Madrid has one of the best public transports. For those who want to go to Santiago Bernabeu, there's a direct bus a block away. Faster than taking the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but dodgy bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: S I
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the Confortel suites Hotel was that it's modern and clean. I held this impression when I saw the triple room I'd be sharing with two friends and i was pleasantly suprised to see that we had three single beds as opposed to one double and one single. The shower room/ bathroom was also very clean, although there was no lock on the two way door and no actual door for the shower, so the floor outside of the shower was wet quite often. I wasn't too keen on the smoke screen window for the bathroom as your silhouette was visible from the outside. Even worst, was the fact that the actual shower was seperated from the bedroom by a smoke screen window which showed a clear silhouette of the person showering from the bedroom. We found this funny but it could be a problem depending on who you're sharing a room with. Another downside was that the shower lever had been loosened and fell off whilst I was showering, had it hit my foot, it would have broken a few bones. I fixed this myself, and in the hotels defense, they can't check every shower lever in the hotel. The matresses were hard and the pillows were thin and uncomfortable to sleep on. However the room was cleaned every day, the bath gel, shampoo and soap was replenished and new towels given. The hotel also provides free wifi and free water in each room. They have computers and internet in the lobby although the connection is unbelievably slow and you're better off using your own phone or laptop with the wifi. The hotel is located in a great place. It's 15 minutes from the airport and 15 minutes from the city centre using the metro. There are some nice local places to eat just behind the station if you don't fancy coughing up for food in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dennis h
Reviews.Content: It is minutes away from the Metro station (Line 4: Alfonso Xiii). It is very convenient if you arrive Madrid at the airport. You can simply take Metro line 8 and transfer to line 4. Room was clean, staff was okay, price was reasonable ( I paid US$ 180 for 2 nights, tax included). However, the internet speed for both in-room WIFI and computer station was extremely slow and unstable . I wanted to plan my trips at night, but I could hardly check my email.

Reviews.Title: “If you visiting Madrid for pleasure, look for another option”
Reviews.Author: Anat100
Reviews.Content: While I am traveling on business in Madrid, Comfortel is my first choice as its ten minutes walk from my office. The hotel is ok, nothing exciting very modest facility comparing to same level hotel in Madrid and in the center. Nice breakfast, staff ok not trying too much and of course is not located in the center.

Reviews.Title: “Practical and Clean”
Reviews.Author: redsonning
Reviews.Content: This is a well presented hotel providing modern functional accommodation. Breakfast is quite a good selection, but if not included in your room price it is charged at eight euros per person. The hotel is some way out of the centre, but the nearby metro is very good and will have you in the centre of town within about fifteen minutes. The hotel is efficient, but lacks character. However it provides what it says and is perfectly acceptable, so no particular problems.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: vaggos
Reviews.Content: its a 3-4 star hotel, modern, nice breakfast, next to metro station and 15 minutes from city center and airport...could be better with cleaning though....

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Cargenty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more of a 3 star hotel, rather than 4. While it had a very nice decoration, the room and bathroom were too small, and the TV looked more like a computer screen. There was also no mirror in the room. The breakfast is very overpriced, considering how right next door there is a place offering a better meal for a third of the price. Have free wifi internet and free water bottles but the daily cleaning was poor. I needed to clean my bathroom. Not in a touristic area, but it is in a nice place, sourrounded by a lot of restaurants, stores and right next to the metro. It is a clean and safe area, and cheap. The room separation is not very good, and you can very easily hear what's hapening in the next room. It's a nice quality/price deal, but there are better ones in its category.

Reviews.Title: “Good one”
Reviews.Author: kitakitana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. Very friendly staff, perfect location (the metro just few minutes away). Rooms very modern with a nice interior - amazing shower, super comfortable bed. The only bad thing we can say is about the noise coming from the maids in the early morning, as we heard doors slaming and girls talking loudly. The area the hotel is located is very good - a lot of places to eat, lods of supermarkets. We would recommend this hotel to anyone, thank u:)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Spain”
Reviews.Author: Travellingpants
Reviews.Content: The hotel was renovated recently and is very centrally located near a metro with easy access to Madrid City centre. The staff were helpful and even alloed us to check in early (10 am), though the official checkin time is 3pm.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: GusBrazil
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just some steps from Alfonso XVIII station, which connects you directly from Barajas International airport. Friendly Neighboorhood with nice restaurants, stores, supermarkets. Also very close from touristic points such as Gran Via Road, Retiro Park and others. Very nice polace toi stay!

Reviews.Title: “You'll get a 4 star room if you're lucky”
Reviews.Author: JohannaGuerrero
Reviews.Content: Well, I should have paid more attention to the reviews, but I was in hurry and booked this hotel because the pictures on Tripadvisor were very nice and the global evaluation of the hotel was quite high. At my arrival I was given a completely outdated suite, which had nothing to do with the lovely photos I had seen while booking and pervaded with a heavy tobacco smell though it was a non-smoking room. There wasn't any roll of toilet paper, nor towels, nor phone to call the receptionist and ask for those. I went back to the reception and while the clerk was preparing my accommodation in another room I asked him why the pictures I had seen on the Internet were different. He explained that there were different rooms and gave me the key of a pretty modern furnished standard room where the sink pipe were leaking all the night. Next morning I told the new receptionist about this and she assured me that the problem would be fixed, but in the evening the pipe were still leaking and, to top it all off, I realised I had tiny roommates, ants. Next morning I informed about the leaking pipe and it was finally fixed. What I liked - the location, the refurbished standard room. What I didn't like - the ants, the outdated suite, breakfast. Good luck with your room!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Asrafk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, Good location, away from city centre, however bus and metro are less than a minute away, Metro is extremely convenient and excellent in Madrid. Getting to and from airport by metro takes less than 20 minutes, with 1 change in between, at the ridiculous price of 2 Euros each way. Rooms are nice with modern decor, however the plumbing were falling apart!!!, Breakfast is OK, Reception staff were quite friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: angelica780
Reviews.Content: very nice and sharp hotel. Friendly staff with great breakfast buffet. Rooms were nice and spacious. Definately would return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: HeatonClassic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the suburbs and is nothing to look at from the outside. entering the hotel my hopes were raised as it is clean and modern, the public areas look nice and clean and bright. Off to reception to check in and a fairly surly male receptionist gave me my keys. When i booked I had asked for a modernised room after reading reviews on this website and was assured I had been allocated one!! The room was painted in easyjet orange combined with grunge black so not very nice but it was clean. it was a very good size with a HUGE bed and a decent sofa but looked out on a service area. The aircon worked well although noisy (they all are) bathroom was a bit tired but had a good shower and bidet and again was clean. When they say modernised i guess it must have been a few years ago, the bathroom was a bit tired, the window did not lock, the shutters did not lock, so no security as the window was at floor level. no worries, I will put valuables in the safe that is provided free of charge. HOWEVER it was not fixed to anything, you could just pick it up and walk out with it under your arm!! The mirror in the sliding glass wardrobe doors was cracked badly and a couple of shelves in the wardrobe were broken. There was however the biggest comfiest bed I have slept in for a long long time, It was about 7ft square with no seams in it, the shutters cut out the light totally so the first night I was asleep soundly till 11am Breakfast in the restaurant is not to be missed (though I had the first morning) and had a great selection of meats, cheeses and fruits plus pastries.some of the hams were superb and my vegetarian partner also found the choice good and interesting. The other staff are all friendly so dont let reception put you off Local area has a great range of cafes, bars and shops plus supermarkets if your budget is limited.Also it only takes a few mins to get into town on the metro which is only a couple of hundred yards from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Rooms better than service”
Reviews.Author: AndrePor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, booked through booking just before arriving at the hotel, got there and the reservation wasn't in the system.. no problem.. I had just just done it 40 min before but it took them 20 min to solve me this problem and at the end when i finally got the key... not even a sorry for the delay... The room is nice, new well decorated and with a "cool" bathroom, good value for the money! There is only a problem that is the sound proof in the room, I got the room next to the elevator (one of thoose talking elevators that every stop says which floor it is) and woke up more than once with the noise. The location is not central but in my case I wasn't going to the center of Madrid and this was quite convenient for me. At checkout another problem with the reception, wrong room rate in my bill, it was over 100euros more that the rate i had booked in booking, after telling them that they quickly changed it and gave me the correct one... sorry was a word that I yet again didn't hear from the front office staff. In sum, nice rooms, good value (if you look online in different sites), but the service of front office staff is terrible. Would i stay there again, probably yes since what I value in Madrid is the facilities and not really the service.

Reviews.Title: “Fewer fishwives.”
Reviews.Author: elilagalesa
Reviews.Content: Well, it was better in that someone had advised the cleaners to pipe down in the morning. The reception staff are as helpful and charming as ever and cannot be faulted... except... Just one complaint, but seeing as this is my home from home whilst in Madrid; reception staff you are helpful to the point of pissing off the guests checking in when an SE Asian princess wants to spend 20 minutes asking inane details and there were 7 of us in a queue because of this lady. Thank God for the woman who asserted herself and got us all checked in because if was down to you we'd all still be waiting now. Apart from that, you're great and I'll keep recommending you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in everyway as long as you stay newer block”
Reviews.Author: yumimb
Reviews.Content: There are different types of room in this hotel. Cheaper room as classic type is older and not so nice however room is bigger than other normal hotel. I stayed junior suits because not so much price difference and I travelled with teenager (need own TV!). Clean modern spacious quiet room. Unlikely other hotels, card key worked every time. Enough mineral waters are supplied everyday by hotel which is very useful. Free internet was usefull too. Location is good. There are nice shops (cheaper than central), cafe, small supermarket open longer than other shops in 5 mints, Metro & McDonald in 2 mints. Taxi cost 8 to 12 euro to most of Central area and easy to catch even Xmas and New Year’s Day however once learn how to use subway, save your money quite bit. My disappointments are....there is no door between washing area and bed room (also bathroom door has gap as a design???) so it was noisy when someone use shower or sink, drier etc. Also there is no box tissue (you can buy next door Chinese shop though). There is no tea or coffee maker. I bought travel kettle in front of the hotel very next day. Although coffee was very good at lobby cafe and they don't mind bring to your room ( roomservice is not from the hotel restaurant, pizza and snack delivery from outside ). I don't recommend to walk around the hotel area in late night alone but safe enough to go dinner or lunch. All staff speaks enough English and nice. I will stay again if I have a chance to visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Big difference between refurbished versus non-refurbished rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Traveler10607
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the hotel for a leisure trip to Madrid. We arrived late at the hotel and were given a room in Bloque I. The room was a suite (separate living and bedroom), but pretty dated and not trendy at all like the hotel pictures in many of the reviews. In the morning, we found our shower was freezing cold, and technicians were unable to fix it, and no other rooms were available to move to since the hotel was fully booked. Not impressed! When we left to sightsee an hour or so later, we were told another room had become available in Bloque III. We were delighted at the clean, trendy room that we received (not a suite like the first, but MUCH MUCH nicer!) The hotel is about a 3 minute walk from a metro stop, which took about 10-15 minutes to get right into the city centre, and about 20 minutes from the airport - very convenient! In summary, make sure you request one of the refurbished rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms for a good price”
Reviews.Author: writecritic
Reviews.Content: As soon as you push open the entrance door you realize that the floors leading to the reception area are well polished and clean, the temperature is just perfect ( specially if you are stepping in at noon in summer) and the staff is courteous. Check-in was quick and hassle-free. We asked for a noise-free room so we were given a room that faced a quiet back street. There were two elevators for each section ( I think there are three sections in the hotel). The elevator we took was extremely tiny. My husband I could barely squeeze in our backpacks! The room was well designed and comfortably sized for two adults. The bathrooms were stylish, modern and extremely clean. We didn´t try the restaurant at the hotel as there are plenty of averagely priced cafes options around this hotel ( there is also a McDonalds just five minutes away!). There is a bus stop that´s a two minute walk from the hotel that takes you to the city center and a train stop that´s less than a minute away. There are 2 computers in the lobby area for guest use. We tried one and found the speed very slow. Overall we found the hotel good. Would consider staying here again when we visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: jadedexpat
Reviews.Content: everything you need, decent price. location close to metro station but not close to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, clean, but terrible internet access and poor followthrough”
Reviews.Author: mustbnearc
Reviews.Content: Poor wireless service in room -- could connect in lobby, but not at all in the room -- made this a terrible hotel for business. More than once the staff promised to have the technician fix it, but it was never followed through. In general, poor service but friendly staff. On the positive side It was a good business locale for me. The staff were friendly, though unable or unwilling to fix the internet problem. The hotel was clean. Good food recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “The world's noisiest cleaners.”
Reviews.Author: elilagalesa
Reviews.Content: It's really well situated for public transport and in a very friendly, safe neighbourhood with some really good local bars. However, don't expect to be able to get a moment's sleep after 7am, even on the weekend. Their cleaning staff really know how to clean, the place is immaculate but the noise they make is ridiculous. I don't appreciate being woken at 6.30am to the sound of a shouted conversation regarding the latest health problems of las empleadas. One more thing, don't accidentally leave anything at the place as even phoning within one hour to ask about lost property is a waste of time. Hope the domestic staff are getting full enjoyment from the possessions which I accidentally left behind. Conclusion; friendly, helpful, charming front desk staff. The rest of them a bunch of vulgar fishwives.

Reviews.Title: “A pitty”
Reviews.Author: pymco
Reviews.Content: The hotel confortel suites in madrid is a beautifulle clean Hotel! The pitty is that as an international traveller it is not near the 4 star service you would expect. The televisions only show snowy spainish channels there are no english spoken channels. This you would expect from a 4 star hotel. On top off this the breakfast is a complete ripoff. Really dont waste youre money on having breakfast her. the breakfast is better Ibis hotels and they are cheap. 70 euro for 4 people breakfast. robbery . Not a 4 star international hotel. Clean it is and the location is fine too

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and affordable stay”
Reviews.Author: Dedun69
Reviews.Content: Got a really good clue from Tripadvisor about asking for block 3 and I did ask and I received. Nice rooms and friendly staff. Hilmi was great the front service desk receptionist who gave us the clue about taking the bus to Burgos instead of the slow train. We never made it early enough to go tfor breakfast, but I liked the hotel and the location as we were able to get to the centre of Madrid within 20 minutes. No compaints and will definitely stay here gain if I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and Helpful staff; cute setup!”
Reviews.Author: DarbyC
Reviews.Content: The staff was so sweet and helpful here. They checked us in quickly and gave us a lot of helpful inormation about the city and where to eat or drink. The hotel is very modern and the rooms are comfortable, as long as you do not expect giant American sized rooms with tons of extra space. Although, throughout Europe I found this to be the standard layout of most hotel rooms. The hotel is very clean and there is a cute breakfast bar that serves café con leche. The surrounding area is very cute, there is a nice café within walking distance "cerveceria gran vuelo" they are very nice, and the pan dulce is tan delicioso!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, large room, location ok but some improvements could be made..”
Reviews.Author: becstravels
Reviews.Content: Favourite aspects of the hotel: - FREE internet wi-fi for the entire duration - Large bed - Good furniture (table and couch and coffee table) - FREE water in the fridge restocked each day - Good room service - Large room - Good powered shower Things that would have made it better: - Fan in the bathroom - Much brighter lights (or just a central light in the middle of the ceiling). The room is extremely dark even with all the lights on. Even during the day. I would almost advise bringing a light! - No Cleaners sweeping the stairs loudly at 7:30am in the morning. Make sure if you hear banging loud noises early in the morning, notify the reception immediately. We did and it took 3 phone calls to reception and half an hour for them to check what the noise was. In the end, we went to check ourselves and it was the hotel cleaner banging the broom down each set of stairs from the top floor to the bottom. Ruined an otherwise great stay. The location is it is RIGHT near Alfonso XIII station so easy to get to the centre, however still would have been better staying in Sol (but you'd obviously have to pay much more!) We were only there for the football.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Fuddy123
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Confortel Sutites over the Easter break and had a fantastic time. The hotel is very easy to get to from the airport and the rooms were extremely clean and tidy. They were perfect for us as we did literally use the hotel as somewhere to sleep! The rooms were cleaned every day, the staff were helpful and the location is ideal for those who are looking to go out and see Madrid. To be honest we didn't use any of the hotels facilities other than the free mini bar which was stocked with water. The rooms have free wi fi for anybody who wants to take their laptop with them and there are also two computers in the lobby that have internet access should you wish to use them. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as often we would just get it on the go. The only thing that was a bit of a let down was that there was no iron in the room and you had to pay for their ironing service. When we asked about it we were told that on Saturdays and Sundays you have to pay more for it which was a bit confusing so we just left it! Apart from that the hotel is PERFECT for the busy madrid tourist!

Reviews.Title: “Could of been longer”
Reviews.Author: pjcat
Reviews.Content: We had two nights in this hotel and enjoyed our stay. Breakfast was good and for the three of us the room was spacious, comfortable and had style. The mini bar and internet were plus. Easy to get to the metro and plenty of food places within easy walk..

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Good location”
Reviews.Author: cazSheffield
Reviews.Content: Do not be put off by earlier reviews, this is a lovely hotel. We booked 3 rooms ( 1 room and 2 suites) and they were all beautiful and spotlessly clean. Also, the rooms were very modern and were much larger than most hotel rooms. The free minibar ( soft drinks) was a bonus. We could not believe the quality for the price we had paid. The hotel is not in the centre but is right opposite the underground that will take you to the centre or the airport in a matter of minutes. Top tip; save time and a fortune on a taxis by catching the underground from the airport to the hotel. You can get on the train at the airport but will need to change line but its easy to do. The only criticism I would make would be about the breakfast. There was a very limited choice of cold items and no bacon, sausage, eggs etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: diy200701
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, done a in a very modern style. It is in a quite, safe residential neighborhood. There is a train station 30 seconds walk from the hotel, and with frequent trains it is easy to reach most popular Madrid attractions in 10-15 minutes. I used Google street view to see how to walk from the train station to the hotel. We arrived at midnight, took the train, and very easily found the hotel at night. The staff is very courteous and attentive, although with very limited English. We did not eat at hotel but it does have very nice bar. At the time of our stay hotel offered FREE wireless internet. I don't know if they will maintain this policy. One item we did not like - our room was right next to the elevator so it can get noisy. However, there were very few people staying at the hotel so it was not such a big issue. Closest Train Station: L4, Alfonso XIII Link on Google Maps: http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&hl=en&geocode=&q=Lopez+de+Hoyos+143,+Madrid,+Spain&sll=40.899613,-73.777494&sspn=0.009456,0.022745&g=Lopez+de+Hoyos+143,+Madrid,+Spain&ie=UTF8&z=16

Reviews.Title: “Confortel Suites Madrid nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eibhling
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in the Confortel Suites Madrid, Lopez de Hoyos, 143 MADRID ES 28002 for a long weekend in Oct. We booked through Placestostay.com, and booked thestandard Room for 4 nights. It was €418 altogether. The room was a little small but clean but they had twin beds pushed together instead of a double. However i asked in the morning if we could have an upgrade and we did as they had some rooms available which was great. This was of little extra cost. The Location was right beside the Metro station and 15 mins away from the centre Sol (which was a change of line) or just about 5 mins to Goa (the main shopping area) which was grand if you didn't mind having to get it. whch we didnt the Metro is brilliant and brings you every where around the city with no real wait. The one thing to note is that if you are going out after 1.30am the metro stops then you willhave to get a taxi home, which is only about 8-10 euro from SOL so not that much. The hotel Staff were lovely. The hotel was clean and had a kind of stylish edge to it rather then comfy . If you prefare to walk outside the door of you hotel and have everything close to you well this may not suit you, but as i said the metro is right beside it. Because they upgraded us this made my stay more enjoyable if this had not of happened i prob would not have rated the hotel as much, If your a couple going for a nice romantic weekend away go for the suite rather then the standard.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Rich1876
Reviews.Content: Booked through lastminute.com. Great deal at just over £50 a night - stayed for 5 nights. The only reason I have't graded it excellent is that we never really used any of the hotel services. The hotel is about 8 metro stops (1 change) from airport - 7 day travel pass was 22 euros. The metro is 100 yards from hotel and its so easy to get in and out to the centre - 1 change, 10mins max to Sol. Room decor was modern, the shower (no bath) was powerful and the minibar was stocked with 6 soft drinks a day (free of charge). I would definitely stay here again. Free safe in room as well but this seems like a nice hotel in a safe area. Location great - metro runs til 1:30am - but if you don't fancy it there are pleanty of places to eat in the local vicinity (walk past metro to main road).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, A quiet retreat from the hustle and bustle!”
Reviews.Author: guitargaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of march and I can highly recommend it. Modern, clean, comfortable hotel about 20 minutes on the tube from the historic centre. We were upgraded when we got there to a superior suite, huge comfortable bed, free minibar, modern styling, flat screen rotating TV. If you want a reasonably priced (we paid around £55 per night), good 4* hotel you really can't go wrong. I can also highly recommend the churros in the cafe about 4 door down opposite the metro. Also have dinner in the cellar at the Botin, we had an amazing night!

Reviews.Title: “Good value city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paddy53
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel - spotlessly clean, large well equiped room, good staff and conveniently placed for the metro. From the station you are about 20 minutes, and one change into the city centre. 1,2 and 3 day metro passes are very good value for money. Our booking included breakfast - there is a good choice of fruit, bread and pastries, and a very slow toaster! Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Style, Convenience”
Reviews.Author: ruzow
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We had a junior suite - it was spacious, bright, and always clean. The towels are large bath sheets, the mini-bar was included - it is only juice, soda, and beer - but that was nice. The buffet breakfast is NOT included and very expensive although very good - it cost over 50 euros for three of us for breakfast. Nice neighborhood, very close to the metro (one block.)

Reviews.Title: “Close to Metro, No Iron”
Reviews.Author: somewhatseasoned
Reviews.Content: Located conveniently next to the Alfonso XIII metro station, the city center was only a few subway stops away. The room was clean, and the mini bar was free. I was traveling on business, and I was surprised that there was no iron in the room, nor was one available to borrow at the front desk. Free wifi was available throughout the hotel, you simply had to ask for the proper code at the front desk. Wifi reception was somewhat spotty in my room, but very strong in the lobby if I needed to ensure that my connection was strong. The location is convenient to public transportation, but there are no "sights" to see in close walking distance to the hotel. The staff speaks English sufficiently, and they were welcoming, but not overly excited when greeting or checking me in. Breakfast was not included in my room rate. There was a small bar that served drinks and food up until 9 or 10pm. This was my first visit to Madrid, and I look forward to returning - the city is clean, has exquisite architecture, great art, and don't forget to tour the Real Madrid soccer/football stadium!

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel near Metro”
Reviews.Author: finestfur
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights to attend trade show at IFEMA. Hotel ideally placed for Metro to historic Madrid, IFEMA & Airport. No immediately obvious choices for eating in the immediate vicinity but didn't spend a great deal of time looking as we headed into the historic areas to eat & sightsee (nb MacDonalds has now closed!) Despite booking online directly through Confortel, the hotel did not have our reservation (deposit had been debited from Credit Card) but check in staff dealt with this efficiently. Only issue can when notes left to explain situation were not interpreted correctly when checking out and full amount was charged in error. Luckily this was spotted immediately and reversed so no harm done. Rooms very clean, modern & new. We had a desk, sofa bed, king bed (US style) LCD tv with english speaking news channels (BBC & CNN) Previous reviewer mentioned that internet in lobby was not working but was fine during our stay.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: American in Middle East, Europe and more to come...
Reviews.Title: “Bang for Buck!”
Reviews.Author: WETRAVEL2GETHER
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using [---]. Check-In was smooth, although nobody spoke English. The rooms are VERY comfortable, clean, and quiet. The bathroom has nice toiletries and a great shower. The free mini-bar is only water, juice, and beer, but a nice touch. Do not rely on the free internet access in the lobby as the provided computers are defunct. Wireless is available to purchase for access from the rooms. The breakfast is pricey but an excellent selection of pastries, cheeses, etc. and everything is very fresh. The location is about 5-10 minutes by car/public transit from the city center, and is a super conventient 1 block walk to metro transportation (so walking tours are still very possible, but I recommend taking public transit to the general area first.) Checkout was simple, although we were slightly overcharged compared to our booking rate. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on a bit more than a budget, but not wanting to splurge on luxury accomodations. Great for business, family,and couples wanting to stay just outside of the city´s comotion, and still have easy access to city and area attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goddesshekate
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel quite recently [ 5 days ago] and was pleasatnly surprised by it as I had never come across this chain of hotels before. Firstly the hotel is positoned very near to the Metro so there is no need to get a taxi to reach it, and it is also relatively near to both Madrid City Centre and the Airport. When I first booked it I was quite concerned that the hotel's distance of 10 Metro stops [or so] from the Aiprort would prove to be time consuming but the Metro Travel time was about 20-25 minutes if that. The hotel itself is both modern and stylish. The reception and downstairs lobby has an almost Japense/Oriental feel to it and the reception area furnishing are reminiscent of Asian culture. The pleasant surprise was that this hotel is actually a 4 star hotel and not a 3 star masquerading as a 4 star which was what I found to be the case in another hotel in which I stayed last night! The bedrooms are spacious, stylish and clean with all the facilites you could need. What I espcially liked was the separate sitting room area which had a sofa, desk, chair, separate TV [with decent channels!], wi fi internate connection and the requisite mini bar, etc. The bedroom area was also very spacious and the bed itself huge. There was also a spearate tv ion this room. All in all I would really recommend this hotel for either the discerning businessman, families as well as solo travellers like myself. There is a restaurant and bar area [although the meals do seem to be a bit pricey although I cold be wrong as I never actually ate there. However, for those travellers who could care less what they eat there is a McDonalds about 2 minutes away from the hotel!!]. All in all a great hotel, very welcoming and certainly worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel with a big and comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Kolia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Confortel for two nights. Big comfortable suite: bedroom + living room. It was clean and quite. Taxi at 02:00 from the airport to the hotel 18.00 EUR. Located a bit out of central Madrid, but very close (50 meters) to the Metro station (subway). Spacious clean lobby, an area with free internet connection. Big queen size bed with a wonderful mattress. This was very important as we were only walking and used the metro only to get to the airport from the hotel. Good air conditioning. Mini bar was free of charge, but was not filled in once we have used it (possibly a normal practice?) Ceiling in the barthroom very low and cracked, bathroom in poor condition, despite of marble floors. 4 stars for space and cleanliness, 2 stars or 1 for maintenance.
